Computer Games 10th Anniversary Addition highlights the upcoming Scar's of Velious expansion.
EverQuest: Scars of Velious Forum: Computer Games 10th Anniversary Addition highlights the upcoming Scar's of Velious expansion.
  

Sysop

Sunday, October 22, 2000 - 12:01 pm
"We are trying to do some new things with Velious. It is linear, in the form of a dungeon," Butler quotes in the article. The idea behind Scars is quite new to EQ. It is goal oriented. Meaning you a challenged with "winning through to a goal". More inline with a good old fashion dungeon raid, the new expansion requires that players fight their way through to certain goals, before you can move on to other zones.

The first challenge to face is the new Coldain Dwarves. The story goes that these Dwarves have long been out of touch with their ancestors. As such, they may be none to friendly to other Dwarves, let alone other races. The Coldain Dwarves live in the fortress of Thurgadin. This fortress is a maze of twists and turns that lead to bridges and large open room, filled with Dwarven fighters and the king of the Coldain himself, Dain.

Velious is much more interactive then other EverQuest zones. This expansion includes a great deal of interaction between the various factions. For example, the nemesis of the Coldain Dwarves are the Storm Giants. If you manage to kill the Dwarf King, then a cry will go up amongst the Storm Giant seers. "We have seen a vision! Our mortal enemy is dead!" and the giants will march off to attack the city of Coldain. In other examples, you may run into a statue of Rallos Zek in the city of the Storm Giants. In some instances the statue will come to life. Players can battle it, and if they defeat it, Rallos Zek himself will appear to battle the players. "It will be a very difficult battle...", Mark Butler states.

Velious as you might guess offers a slew of new items and armor. According to the article, there are two new sets of armor type available in the expansion, with a total of 156 new textures. One type of armor is targets at those level 35 and above and the other at players level 55 through 60. Also, new to the expansion is a new interface (thank goodness!). The article does not give a lot of detail, but Mark stats the new GUI will be fully 3D and configurable. "Our goal is to get rid of the graphic overlays", meaning NO MORE STATIC 640x480 GUI!. The shape and feel of this new GUI is still in the design mode (hmm, its almost November....).

The interface will include a number of other nifty new features. For example, a player will be able to tie an emote and text message to an action, such as casting a spell. For example, a druid could cast a snare on a enemy and the emote message you could have him perform might be to wave at the ensnared creature and say "I be running along now....". The idea here is to allow players for further personalize characters to act and behave as they wish them to. This could be good, and this could be bad.. (think about the many "DIE DUDE, RUDE GESTURE" we are likely to see).

Velious is due out in December, and we are looking forward to it. Hope to see you at the Vegas Launch Party!
